newsitem.title: UK: Sugar freight market quiet, fixtures scarce.
newsitem.headline: Sugar freight market quiet, fixtures scarce.

text.p: Business was subdued on the sugar freight market on Wednesday with little fresh business to inspire a recovery in rates, shipbrokers said.
New orders included CSR, which quoted for 35,000 tonnes min/max bulk sugar from Queensland to Crockett with San Franciso option for 25 November/5 December shipment dates.
UBC issued an account order for 14,000 tonnes of bagged sugar from Continent to Persian Gulf for December shipment.
Louis Dreyfus was open for 4,200 tonnes min/max bagged sugar from Paranagua to Callao for prompt dates, shipbrokers said.
No firm business was reported, they added.
